column4: hello everyone, this will probably seem like a stupid question, but what do you reckon is better for system resources using a mail client like Thunderbird or access emails through webmail (i.e. browser)?
well, gmail is faster than any desktop client x)
I'm wondering, because I'm having trouble with system resources apparently, in fact I'm also considering switching to Kubuntu from Ubuntu (11.10) as I read that KDE is more efficient resource wise
you don't really have to 'change' to kubuntu, you can just install 'kubuntu-desktop' package on your current installation to install "kubuntu"
sudo dpkg-reconfigure lightdm (or kdm) lets you choose between login managers
if you're gonna run kde you probably wanna change to kdm
xfce might be worth trying too
so Xubuntu is Ubuntu with xfce? I always wondered what that was
all ubuntu/xubuntu/kubuntu are all in the exact same repositories, they aren't anyhow 'separate' distros apart from default packages at install cd's
so you can install and test them simply by apt-getting stuff
so what happens is I change the desktop environment but would still use Ubuntu's apps (and those that I have installed myself after Ubuntu's installation?)
none of those get removed, you can run them just fine regardless of desktop environment
